quotes.quote: Better to ask the way than go astray.
Bloom where you're planted.
Curiosity killed the cat.
Don't bite off more than you can chew.
Even though you have ten thousand fields, you can eat but one measure of rice a day.
Every man has his price.
Gold is the devil's fishhook.
If passion drives, let reason hold the reins.
If you  don't want trouble, don't go looking for it.
It's better to find a whole worm in your apple than half a worm.
Never pick up what you didn't put down.
Never trouble trouble 'til trouble troubles you.
Nor eye in a letter, nor hand in a purse, nor ear in the secret of another.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.
The crow may be caged but his thoughts are in the cornfield.
The devil catches most souls in a golden net.
The devil tempts but doesn't force.
The grass is always greener in someone else's yard.
There is a charm about the forbidden that makes it unspeakably desirable.
The devil doesn't come dressed in a red cape and pointy horns. He comes as everything you've ever wished for.
Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.
The greatest temptations are not those that solicit our consent to obvious sin, but those that offer us great evils masking as the greatest goods.
Temptation is stronger in the minds of people who are in doubt. Prayer makes it weaker.
Sometimes we have to behave indifferent towards people who proclaim their love to us, just to see if they are really different.
Temptation likes best those who think they have a natural immunity, for it may laugh all the harder when they succumb.
Temptation is the fire that brings up the scum of the heart.
Every conquering temptation represents a new fund of moral energy. Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before.
Temptation is like a knife, that may either cut the meat or the throat of a man; it may be his food or his poison, his exercise or his destruction
Some temptations come to the industrious, but all temptations attack the idle.
Temptation wrings integrity even as the thumbscrew twists a man's fingers.
